thread.title: Southbound Interstate 5 through Portland to close for 6 nights
thread.title_full: Southbound Interstate 5 through Portland to close for 6 nights | OregonLive.com

author: Jerry Casey | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Southbound Interstate 5 through Portland to close for 6 nights
text:
Starting Friday, Interstate 5's southbound lanes between the Fremont and Marquam bridges will be closed for six nights of repaving and sign replacement work .
The Oregon Department of Transportation said in a news release that all southbound traffic will be directed onto Interstate 405 and across the Fremont Bridge starting at 10 each night.
Workers will begin closing lanes at 7 p.m. and interstate on-ramps at 9 p.m.
Southbound lanes will reopen at 10 a.m. Saturday and Sunday. On weekdays, all lanes will reopen at 5 a.m.
The state transportation department offers these specifics about ramps through the closure area:
Ramp from southbound I-5 to eastbound Interstate 84 will remain open. Ramp from westbound Interstate 84 to southbound I-5 will close. North Greeley Avenue on-ramp to southbound I-5 will remain open. The Moda Center on-ramp to southbound I-5 will remain open until 11 p.m. on nights when there are events at the arena. The work on southbound I-5 will continue nightly through Thursday, Oct. 29. Northbound traffic lanes will remain open through the work.
-- Jerry Casey
